column2: the service is pretty hit-or-miss. I've had some great experiences
column3: and some head-scratching ones. The prices are also pretty steep for a ramen place--you'll shell out close to $20 if you add a few toppings--but I suppose you're paying for the atmosphere
column4: which is admittedly pretty dope. At the end of the day
column5: the ambiance and food definitely make Jinya a crowd-pleaser and compensate for the restaurant's shortcomings.
